<topcClas>Management and organisation - Industry and management</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The Workplace Industrial Relations Survey (WIRS) series was designed to contribute to a better understanding of the processes which underlie employment relationships by making available for the first time large, systematic and dispassionate evidence about a broad range of industrial relations and employment practices across almost every sector of the economy.<br> Data from the 1990 WIRS survey are also included in a later panel survey in the series, 'Workplace Employee Relations Survey, 1998 : Panel Survey 1990-1998', held under SN:4026</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> The survey consists of questionnaire responses from managers, financial managers and workers' representatives at establishments sampled. The main areas covered include: basic establishment data on size, industrial category, ownership, etc.; management organisation for industrial relations; union organisation; bargaining structure; procedures; payment methods; industrial action; the introduction of technical and organisational change and a variety of other factors.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1990-01-01T00:00:00Z">January 1990</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1990-09-01T00:00:00Z">September 1990</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No information recorded</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Institutions/organisations</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Employees</universe>         <universe>Establishments</universe>         <universe>Managers</universe>         <universe>Trade union officers</universe>         <universe>All working establishments in England, Scotland and Wales, listed in the 1987 Census of Employment and stated to have employed 25 or more employees at the time of the census.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Social and Community Planning Research</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>1900 (target)   2061 (obtained)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No information recorded</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>         <collSize>Record Length: 80 bytes per record   <br> ;
